@deandreamatias will leave this open, but there was a PR brought over to improve this
https://github.com/leoafarias/fvm/pull/576, will document later
@leoafarias Assign issue to me please, I can fix it in case there is really something not working as expected.

Ok, I investigated a bit further: https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/issues/6616

Unfortunately, the behavior has changed to resolve symlinks which was not the case, when I did the PR #576. 

So, at the moment, it seems that with Android Studio the automatic SDK switch is broken. 

Best would be, if the Flutter Plugin supports FVM, see: https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/issues/6289 - which is not likely to happen from the official team.

In `.idea/libraries/` are several files with paths to the SDK. Before the current behavior, the IDE wrote a `PROJECT_DIR` path in it. With the current behavior, it resolves the symlink and writes ` USER_HOMEDIR` paths in it, which breaks the dynamic SDK switch.
FVM _could_ update those paths, but this will likely get overwritten by the IDE anytime, so it will break again.  

It looks like `puro.dev` is doing it: https://github.com/pingbird/puro/blob/146a79d729aff35dc2282bb076047d1e166f1e21/puro/lib/src/workspace/intellij.dart#L75-L160 - so they will have the same issue as soon as the plugin is saving something different/new paths.

I understand that it might be out of scope for FVM to support this, considering it all depends on IntelliJ's (or specifically the Dart plugin for IntelliJ?) way of pointing to the Dart SDK and a change there could have FVM breaking things.
Puro does take this by changing the IntelliJ generated files.

Would it be possible to provide an opt-in way to do the same thing as Puro? Maybe even by providing hooks, like _post use version_, where the user can have their own script do this so it doesn't need to become core to FVM?
@dumazy I am exploring a way to accomplish this, will have more soon

title: [Feature Request] Improve docs for configuration Android Studio
